description: Flavorful white bean and potato stew flavored with roasted garlic and caramelized shallots. An easy vegan soup recipe for any time of year!
name: White Bean Stew with Caramelized Shallot, Roasted Garlic, and Purple Potato
recipeIngredient: 2 medium purple potatoes (diced (or use other types of potatoes, about 1.5 cups cubed)
1 tsp balsamic vinegar or cider vinegar
1 tbsp white or yellow miso (for soy allergies, try chickpea miso)
1 and 1/2 cups cooked white beans (1 can) rinsed and drained)
1 tbsp balsamic vinegar or cider vinegar
freshly ground pepper and salt (to taste)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit. Slice off the top of the head of garlic, partly exposing all of the individual cloves. Completely wrap the head of garlic in foil and place on a baking sheet or in a muffin tin. Do the same with the diced potatoes, making 2 or 3 wrapped foil pockets with about 1/2 cup each of potato in them.

The garlic will be done in about 45 minutes, or when completely soft. Unwrap the foil and let it cool, then squeeze the roasted garlic out of the cloves, and mash them with a fork if needed to break them up. The potato will be done in 30-35 minutes.
